tasks.title: What would you like us to call the the person that has passed away?

required.message: What would you like us to call the the person that has passed away?

tooltip.help: For example we can call them by their first name, their title and surname, or even by a name that you knew them as.

questions.label: Title
Surname
First name

required.message: Please enter the deceased's first name

questions.label: Any other names

tooltip.help: For example maiden names or previous names.

required.message: Please enter the deceased's date of birth

Occupation
Do you know their National Insurance Number?

required.message: Please select whether you know the deceased National Insurance Number

tooltip.help: You can find their National Insurance number on their payslip, P60, or on letters about tax, pensions and benefits.

questions.label: What is their National Insurance Number?

required.message: Please enter the deceased's NI number

ninumber.message: Your national insurance number is invalid

questions.label: Did they live permanently in England or Wales at the date of death?

required.message: Please select the deceased residential status

tooltip.gov: Living permanently means they had either their permanent or principal home in England and Wales at the date of death or they intended to return to England and Wales to live permanently.

Please register the death

tasks.title: Register the death at any register office

tooltip.gov: If you use the one in the area where the person died you’ll be given the documents you’ll need on the day. &/If you use a different register office the documents will be sent to the office in the area where the person died before they’re issued to you. This means you’ll usually wait a few days.&/ Registering the death will take about 30 minutes - you might need to make an appointment. &/ What you need to do

questions.label: Did {{q100}} make any gifts, over £3,000 per year, in the 7 years prior to their death? (other than normal birthday, festive, marriage or civil partnership gifts)

tooltip.gov: In the 7 years before they died, did the deceased: make any gifts or other transfers totalling more than £3,000 per year, other than normal birthday, festive, marriage or civil partnership gifts?

questions.label: Is the total value of these gifts more than £150,000?
Do the assets qualify as 'specified transfers?'

tooltip.gov: To qualify as ‘specified transfers’ the assets given away can only be: • cash • listed stocks and shares • household and personal goods • houses, land and buildings

questions.label: Do you have all the bank statements going back 7 years?

tasks.title: Write to all the banks that {{q100}} had an account with in the past 7 years and ask for the bank statements going back 7 years
Check the bank statements for any gifts made, over £3,000, in the 7 years prior to {{q100}}'s death? (other than normal birthday, festive, marriage or civil partnership gifts)

questions.label: Were they the beneficiary of any trusts in the 7 years prior to their death?

tooltip.gov: Did the deceased have the right to receive the benefit from any assets held in a trust that were treated as part of their estate for Inheritance Tax purposes?

questions.label: Was there more than one trust?
Was the amount held in this trust above £150,000?
Did they give up their right to benefit from any assets held in trust?

tooltip.gov: Did they give up their right to benefit from any assets held in trust that were treated as part of their estate for Inheritance Tax purposes?

questions.label: Did {{q100}} own or benefit from any assets outside the United Kingdom?
Are the assets worth more than £100,000?
Did they ever gift something where they could still benefit from the gifted asset?

tooltip.help: For example transferring their property to someone but still living in it.
tooltip.gov: Did they make a gift, where they continued to benefit from, or had some right to benefit from, or use all or part of the asset?

questions.label: Was this gift made after 17 March 1986?
Did they ever gift something to someone who wasn’t able to take full possession of it?

tooltip.help: For example transferring their property to someone but still living in it.
tooltip.gov: Did they gift something where the person receiving the gift did not take full possession of it?

questions.label: Was this gift made after 17 March 1986?
Has {{q100}} received an income from an asset previously owned or that {{q100}} contributed to buying?

tooltip.help: For example giving a property to, or buying a property for, someone and receiving rent in return.
tooltip.gov: Did the deceased make an election on form IHT500 ‘Election for Inheritance Tax to apply to asset previously owned’ that an Income Tax charge should not apply to: 1. assets they previously owned, in which they retained a benefit | 2. the deceased’s contribution to the purchase price of assets acquired by another person, but in which the deceased retained a benefit?

questions.label: Did the deceased pay for any life insurance policies for someone else who wasn’t a surviving spouse or civil partner?

tooltip.gov: Did the deceased pay premiums on any life insurance policies that were not for their own benefit or did not pay out to the estate, and did they buy an annuity at any time? Ignore any policies paid out to a surviving spouse or civil partner.

questions.label: Did the deceased have any kind of pension arrangement other than the State Pension?
Did the deceased change or dispose of their pension in the 2 years before they died?
Did they have a Will written during their life?
Do you have the Will or a copy of the latest Will?
Is the Will held by a professional?

tasks.title: Write to the professional to obtain the original or a copy of the Will

tooltip.help: Usually, a death certificate and all executors of the Will have to send their signed authority for it to be released.

tasks.title: Obtain the original or a copy of the Will

tooltip.help: The Will may be stored with: A legal professional that dealt with {{100}} (solicitor, accountant or financial advisor), {{100}}'s bank or a Will register.

tasks.title: Have the Will read by a professional.

questions.label: Have you had the funeral?
Have you arranged the funeral?
How much is the funeral invoice?
